intro: Alyxia gynopogona, commonly known as the red-flowered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often with a distinctive corolla shape. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Alyxia gynopogona is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
